title: Soaring heat blamed for at least 2 deaths in Romania
description:
(5 Aug 2017) Romania has reported two heat-related deaths with a 45-year old man collapsing and dying on Friday while working in a field in the northeast, and another 60-year-old man dying of a heart attack in the street in an eastern port on Thursday.
Meteorologists issued a "red code" heat alert for Saturday, with soaring temperatures expected to subside only after sunset.
Temperatures in capital Bucharest were forecast to reach up to 40 degrees Celsius (104 degrees Fahrenheit).
Police banned heavy traffic on major roads in daylight hours during the weekend because of the heat wave, while trains were going slower due to the heat. 
Authorities have told people not to go outside during peak hours and urged adults not to leave children in cars in the scorching weather.
The heat wave is expected to last until the middle of next week.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/84f976a4fc370a15b748c67f2216d4ae 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork
